entries.meaning: (cricket, colloquial)  A shot in which the ball passes over the boundary without touching the ground, for which the batting team is awarded 6 runs; a six.
A Cub Scout or Brownie who leads a group of six.  Whence also Senior Sixer.
examples: Many packs have a sixer's council where the sixers, and sometimes the seconds, meet with Akela and some of the other leaders.

entries.meaning: (slang) A prison sentence of six months
examples: The copper knew I did that job, and had me up on suspicion some time after, and gave me a drag (three months) over it. The next bit I did was a 'sixer' (six months), and I escaped from prison in about three weeks after I got it.
